column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Parasitic nematodes are pests affecting crop yields and quality in many important crops such as cotton ( Gossypium hirsutum L. ) , the most economically significant fiber crop .

#Text=The most damaging nematode parasites in the U.S. cotton crop are root-knot ( Meloidogyne incognita ) , reniform ( Rotylenchulus reniformis ) , and sting ( Belonolaimus longicaudatus ) nematodes .
#Text=The southern root-knot nematode ( RKN ) M. incognita is considered the most damaging in part because it occurs widely from California to North Carolina .
#Text=Infection of M. incognita to plant roots is intimately involved in its life-cycle .

#Text=The infective second-stage juvenile ( J2 ) enters plant roots and migrates to the vascular tissues , where it transforms certain vascular cells into multinucleate and hypertrophied so-termed “ giant cells ” , which become the nematodes ’ feeding and reproduction sites .
#Text=To transform and maintain the giant cells , the nematodes secrete effector proteins into the plants via the stylet in their mouth parts .
#Text=The nematode will then become sedentary , use the giant cells as feeding sites , go through J3 and J4 molts , and develop into a reproductive female which will lay thousands of eggs .
#Text=The infected roots will become gnarled ; the feeding sites are colloquially called “ knots ” .
#Text=Some genes coding for the effector proteins that facilitate parasitism have been identified ; however , the regulation of such gene expression remains unclear .

#Text=MicroRNAs ( miRNAs ) are an extensive class of small ( ~21 nt ) noncoding endogenous RNA molecules . miRNA-mediated gene silencing is a fundamental regulatory mechanism of gene expression . miRNAs inhibit gene expression by binding to specific sites located at the 3′ untranslated region ( UTR ) of the target mRNAs and degrade or inhibit its translation .
#Text=More than 30 % of protein-coding genes may be regulated by miRNAs .

#Text=Thus , miRNAs play a significant role in the regulation of almost all critical biological processes in plant and animals ; they act as regulatory switches , controlling reproduction and developmental timing , signal transduction , cell fate , apoptosis , and response to environmental stressors .
#Text=Knowledge of individual miRNA regulation in nematodes has been primarily obtained from model , free-living species such as Caenorhabditis elegans and some animal parasites .
#Text=For example , the miRNAs lin-4 and let-7 function as key regulators of developmental timing in C. elegans .
#Text=Lin 4 controls early stage development in C. elegans , while miRNA let-7 mediates transition of C. elegans larvae to adults .
#Text=Aberrant expression of either of these miRNAs causes aberrant development and growth of C. elegans . miRNAs function by targeting protein-coding genes .
#Text=For example , miRNA lin-4 targets lin-14 , which regulates the timing of cell division during postembryonic development .
#Text=The miRNA let-7 targets hbl-1 , which regulates developmental timing and affects locomotion and egg-laying .
#Text=However , much work on the role of miRNAs in the major agricultural pest nematode , M. incognita has not been accomplished .

#Text=With the draft genome of M. incognita available , it may be possible to identify miRNAs in M. incognita and further study their functions in regulating reproduction , development , metabolism , and parasitism .

#Text=Our previous work and that of others have identified M. incognita miRNAs isolated from pepper roots ( Capsicum annuum L. ) and identified certain miRNAs that were conserved in other parasitic nematodes .
#Text=It is known that expression of miRNAs corresponds with developmental stages and can be induced by biotic and abiotic stresses .
#Text=To date , there has been no study of the miRNA expression profile of M. incognita concurrent with its infection of cotton .
#Text=Additionally , there is no study reporting the temporal miRNA expression changes at different developmental stages of M. incognita .

#Text=Several reports indicate the benefits and efficiency of using RNAi-related strategies for controlling critical gene functions in nematodes , highlighting the importance of better understanding the process of small RNA regulation of gene expression in RKN .
#Text=Our results have potential to be used in integrated pest management programs and together with biopesticides and basic substances .
